reviews.review_msg: I'm so glad that he did not make this class buy a textbook! He helped students save money that way! He is capable of presenting serious concepts in a smooth and controlled way during lecture. Get ready to do a ton of reading though :)

This prof did not want to increase his students' tuition costs, so he made all the readings available on Canvas and did not make them buy a textbook! His lectures are spectacular, though the readings are too lengthy!
Best prof I've ever had. I loved him. He was so funny and interactive. Definitely take his class if you have the opportunity

By far the best professor I have had at SFU. Great lecturer, very passionate, and his workload is very manageable. Participation is a must, but the course content lends itself to discussion, so keep up with the readings and stay engaged. Cannot recommend taking courses with Jamie enough.

Went into this class as an elective but left really enjoying it and going to miss having Jamie as a prof. He puts the students first and wants everyone to do well. You can tell he loves what he does and don't be afraid to participate and ask questions. Material does need to be studied to get a good mark but it's nothing crazy/unreasonable.
Jamie was probably my favourite prof. He is really fun and truly loves his job. He will chat about life and genuinely interacted with us students. His class was a great experience

This class is based mostly off quizzes and exams. But, the prof is super caring and wants to help his students. He is very considerate of his students and is willing to accommodate. I took this class as an elective and I loved it!! He is also very funny and you can always have a conversation with him about anything. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!

Professor Horncastle is one of the best professors I've had at SFU. His lectures are interesting, and you can tell he is passionate about what he teaches! All assignments are provided with clear instructions, and he always provides great feedbacks. He is friendly and open to questions or concerns!

great teacher- really cares about his students and wants to make sure everyone understands the material and is willing to help. he teaches difficukt concepts but loves to talk about his pets and make jokes. readings are all online, no textbooks to buy. have taken multiple classes with him.

Jamie is very easy-going and down-to-earth, while providing a clear feedback on assignments. In HUM150, we were graded by in-class assessments & class participation. Overall a great dude who is clearly passionate about what he teaches and a compassionate professor. No required textbook & posts his ppt pdfs online.

Hum 350

Jamie is super easy to get along with. He makes attending class fun and interactive. Even during our breaks he kept things interesting by discussing things from life stories to current events to historical topics. He's good on grading and will try to give you marks where he can; he puts more of a focus on learning than assignments

I took HUM 121 with him. If I were to choose a role model for all the profs, I would definitely select Jamie. He is caring and understanding to an unbelievable degree! He also doesn't secretly discriminate against anyone and is there to lend you a hand when needed. No textbooks are needed! Instead, he offers interesting material from the library.

Took HUM 121 with him 
(Not HUM 150, RMP didn't have option)

Definitely attend lectures and take notes. His presentation slides aren't comprehensive, usually had to do extra research to grasp the concepts. Unless you know your history, he assumes you immediately understand a topic or had prior knowledge. Review your notes THOROUGHLY before exams.

All the previous reviews are correct, James is caring and considerate. He's very approachable for help etc. However, for a 1st yr class this was unnecessarily hard. His criteria makes it impossible to get a near perfect score even though his feedback will say it was great work. His lectures are so boring I struGGLED to get thru, it was brutal.

He is amazing. Wonderful prof. The Course is kinda Greece-oriented. So you will do well if you know Greek history. You'll have to read extra readings to score well. 4 discussions and 2 exams are fine if you go to lectures and learn the materials. He gives out good feedbacks and answers all questions.

Jamie is everything a university professor should be. He has a wealth of knowledge, hes engaging, and respectful. He genuinely wants his students to develop an interest in the material. Excellent teacher and great guy.

Great lecturer and great guy. His classes do have a substantial workload (papers) and a rigid marking scheme, but he's available for help and flexible with deadlines. Class participation induces reflective discussion which is what academia is supposed to be all about!

Honestly, one of my favourite profs at SFU. I had no background knowledge in the class but he made it easy to understand, fun, and was really down to earth. He's understanding, and willing to give you extra time for assignments if you ask. Such a great prof!
Awesome professor, extremely accommodating to his students and goes the extra mile to help his students. Office hours very worthwhile!

Could not have more positive things to say about James. I highly suggest taking classes with him as he is highly interested in his topic, well prepared, and gives great feedback for adjustments. Not in history, but would consider taking more classes if he taught!

Knows his stuff, highly approachable / available, and will always help you despite being a strict marker. Consistent communication will get you through his tough(er) research papers. Exams and assignments are fair. Don't have enough good things to say about the guy.

Great professor, if you have the chance take a class with him! Flexible and understanding with deadlines, willing to meet and discuss grades and assignments outside of office hours, gave great feedback and structured expectations for assignments. Overall great professor and very helpful.
Super hard marker but approachable and nice but I would not take his class again

Great prof. Passionate about the topic, clear about expectations. I enjoyed the class (I dig history). Exams require basic review and some critical thinking for essay questions. Show up to class and skim over readings for tutorial. He's available for help and super reasonable.

Lectures are interesting. Readings are all provided via email and are well-related. He cares for students and is passionate about what he is teaching. Very kind and approachable. We had 3 quizzes, a paper proposal, and a final paper. Would definitely recommend.
A great guy and a great professor! Approachable and fair. If I can take more classes with him I will. All readings for class are online.

Great professor, passionate, helpful and interested in the topic, get ready to work but be rewarded for it both in learning and grades, lineament with timelines tough with grades. Does not require text books but expects you to use some to support your study. Provides all necessary class material for free if you show you need it , helps with sources
Very passionate about Greek History. Tries to make lectures entertaining, lots of participation which makes time go by much quicker. Very fun prof overall
